history.content:
Please see the email below from the Student Information System team. The Options/Swap bug should now be fixed and you can use this feature again. **If you are still having enrollment issues with any 3-component course please contact sishelp@berkeley.edu.** 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are writing to inform/update you of a known issue with the “Swap” function in CalCentral which may affect students who are enrolled in three-component courses (Lecture, Lab, Discussion, etc.).

Issue:

Due to a technical issue with Oracle’s Campus Solutions software, some “Swap” requests for three-component courses are currently being executed incompletely. Students who attempt to “Swap” discussion and/or lab components of three-component courses may be dropped from one component without being successfully enrolled in another.

Who this affects:

This only affects students who are enrolled in a three-component course and want to “Swap” components, such as discussion times, labs, etc.

What to do:

Do not try to “Swap” a discussion or lab in a three-component class until 1/29/18.. Attempting to “Swap” may result in the student being dropped from discussions and/or labs.

Additionally, do not attempt to drop a discussion/lab and then immediately re-enroll in another discussion/lab. Students who voluntarily drop a class component cannot be guaranteed a spot.

Scheduled Resolution:

Oracle has issued a technical fix for this issue. The SIS team has elevated the installation of this fix to “Emergency Release Status” and the fix is scheduled for Sunday, 1/28/18.

If you want to “Swap” class components, please wait until this technical issue is resolved on Sunday, 1/28/18.

For updates or more information, please view sis.berkeley.edu/help/known-issues

Thank you.

Student Information Systems
history.subject: Another Swap/Options bug update
